lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Offerings of mark bonds declined to 1.3 billion dlrs from around three billion dlrs in the two previous months, whilst strong advances were recorded in the euro-Australian and euro-Canadian dollar sectors, where new offerings exceeded one billion dlrs, the OECD said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Borrowing on the international capital markets contracted significantly in March with 23.1 billion dlrs of medium and long-term funds raised, down 3.4 billion from February and about nine billion dlrs less than in March 1986, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said in its latest monthly report.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: For the first quarter as a whole, the OECD said, funds raised on the floating rate bond market totalled three billion dlrs, the lowest figure since the third quarter of 1982.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Offerings of mark bonds declined to 1.3 billion dlrs from around three billion dlrs in the two previous months, whilst strong advances were recorded in the euro-Australian and euro-Canadian dollar sectors, where new offerings exceeded one billion dlrs, the OECD said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Borrowing on the international capital markets contracted significantly in March with 23.1 billion dlrs of medium and long-term funds raised, down 3.4 billion from February and about nine billion dlrs less than in March 1986, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said in its latest monthly report.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: For the first quarter as a whole, the OECD said, funds raised on the floating rate bond market totalled three billion dlrs, the lowest figure since the third quarter of 1982.
